text: (bright music)
- My name is Curtis Greenwood,

and I'm an account executive
based out of Toronto.
Almost two years I've been at AWS.

I think the biggest surprise
in my previous sales jobs,
I was selling into IT,
working with IT directors or IT managers.

And at AWS, you're able
to not only go to a CIO
within the IT department,
but you can take it to other departments
and go to the executive level.
I've even had meetings with the CEO.

So you can really shape
where the business is going.
Another difference to previous sales roles
would definitely be the resources,

the specialists that I can
lean on for basically anything
in unique situations that are so obscure.
You can go down a rabbit hole

and just talk to all
kinds of different people,
bounce around and find the right resource
to help the customer, ultimately.
What we really do for customers
is help them focus less on IT

or what we call
undifferentiated heavy lifting,

so worrying about those
servers, for example,
and really help them focus
on being more creative in their business
and reapplying their resources,
so they can be more productive,

so they can grow revenue and
do all those great things.
With this job, the world's your oyster.
You can do, really, whatever you want.

You can be as creative
as you'd like to be.
So you have to be open-minded,
willing to try different things,

and always be thinking
of something different.
Well, if you want to have the autonomy,
have your own book of business, really,

to help and have all
these talented resources

that you could potentially
work out of all over the world

that can help you with the
companies you're working
and have the power of the cloud as well
to help these companies be more innovative
and talk beyond just an IT department

or one specific department
and go beyond that,
to the breadth of the company
and talking to the different executives,

definitely, this is
the place you wanna go.
(bright music)
